description: '''Chutney music''' ([[Caribbean Hindustani]]: à¤šà¤Ÿà¤¨à¥€ à¤¸à¤‚à¤—à¥€à¤¤, ğ‘‚’ğ‘‚—ğ‘‚¢ğ‘‚² ğ‘‚®ğ‘‚‘ğ‘‚¹ğ‘‚ğ‘‚²ğ‘‚, {{nastaliq|Ú†Ù¹Ù†ÛŒ Ù…ÙˆØ³ÛŒÙ‚ÛŒ}}) is a fusion genre of Indian folk music, specifically [[Bhojpuri music|Bhojpuri]] folk music, with [[Caribbean]] calypso and soca music, and later with [[Bollywood]] music. This genre of music that developed in Trinidad and Tobago, Guyana and Suriname and is popular in [[Jamaica]], other parts of the Caribbean, [[Fiji]], [[Mauritius]], and [[South Africa]]. Chutney music emerged mid-20th century and reached a peak of popularity during the 1980s. Several sub-genres have developed, most notably [[chutney soca]].
